entry.name: focusin
entry.title: .focusin()
entry.desc: Bind an event handler to the "focusin" event.

argument.name: handler
argument.desc: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

argument.name: eventData
argument.desc: An object containing data that will be passed to the event handler.

argument.name: handler
argument.desc: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

longdesc.p: This method is a shortcut for .on( "focusin", handler ) in the first two variations, and .trigger( "focusin" ) in the third.

The focusin event is sent to an element when it, or any element inside of it, gains focus. This is distinct from the focus event in that it supports detecting the focus event on parent elements (in other words, it supports event bubbling).
This event will likely be used together with the focusout event.

example.desc: Watch for a focus to occur within the paragraphs on the page.
